revised_title: The Influence of Adsorbed Films on Metal Friction
tldr: The authors conducted an experimental study on the frictional behavior of degassed metal surfaces and found that clean metal surfaces adhere with the bulk strength of the metal when in contact. Adsorbed films on the metal surfaces can significantly affect friction, with the most effective lubricants being those that form a solid and chemically attached film. The results support the view that friction of metals is mainly due to adhesion at the points of real contact, and is governed by the extent to which surface films can reduce metallic contact.
